data.current_description:
Updates configuration settings of this basket.

Special configuration parameters for request forwarding:
  * `insecure_tls` controls certificate verification when forwarding requests. Setting this parameter to `true`
allows to forward collected HTTP requests via HTTPS protocol even if the forward end-point is configured with
self-signed TLS/SSL certificate. **Warning:** enabling this feature has known security implications.
  * `expand_path` changes the logic of constructing taget URL when forwarding requests. If this parameter is
set to `true` the forward URL path will be expanded when original HTTP request contains compound path. For
example, a basket with name **server1** is configured to forward all requests to `http://server1.intranet:8001/myservice`
and it has received an HTTP request like `GET http://baskets.example.com/server1/component/123/events?status=OK`
then depending on `expand_path` settings the request will be forwarded to:
    * `true` => `GET http://server1.intranet:8001/myservice/component/123/events?status=OK`
    * `false` => `GET http://server1.intranet:8001/myservice?status=OK`
data.summary_suggestion: Update basket configuration and forwarding settings
data.description_suggestion: Updates the configuration settings for the specified basket. Accepts a Config object in the request body with parameters such as forwarding URL, response behavior, and special options. Key configuration parameters include: `insecure_tls` (allows HTTPS forwarding with self-signed certificates; security warning applies), and `expand_path` (controls URL path expansion when forwarding requests with compound paths). Requires basket token authentication. The basket name is provided as a path parameter. Returns the updated configuration.

data.current_description:
Allows to configure HTTP response of this basket. The service will reply with configured response to any HTTP request sent to the basket with appropriate HTTP method.

If nothing is configured, the default response is HTTP 200 - OK with empty content.
data.description_suggestion: Configures the HTTP response that the service will return for requests to this basket matching the specified HTTP method. Accepts a Response object with status code, headers, and body. This configuration persists and overrides the default HTTP 200 OK response. Subsequent requests to the basket with this method will receive the configured response. Returns the updated Response configuration.

data.current_description:
Updates configuration settings of this basket.

Special configuration parameters for request forwarding:
  * `insecure_tls` controls certificate verification when forwarding requests. Setting this parameter to `true`
allows to forward collected HTTP requests via HTTPS protocol even if the forward end-point is configured with
self-signed TLS/SSL certificate. **Warning:** enabling this feature has known security implications.
  * `expand_path` changes the logic of constructing taget URL when forwarding requests. If this parameter is
set to `true` the forward URL path will be expanded when original HTTP request contains compound path. For
example, a basket with name **server1** is configured to forward all requests to `http://server1.intranet:8001/myservice`
and it has received an HTTP request like `GET http://baskets.example.com/server1/component/123/events?status=OK`
then depending on `expand_path` settings the request will be forwarded to:
    * `true` => `GET http://server1.intranet:8001/myservice/component/123/events?status=OK`
    * `false` => `GET http://server1.intranet:8001/myservice?status=OK`
data.summary_suggestion: Update basket configuration and forwarding settings
data.description_suggestion:
Updates the configuration settings for the specified basket. Accepts a Config object in the request body. Supports partial updates - only provided fields will be modified. Key configuration options include:

- `insecure_tls`: When true, allows forwarding to HTTPS endpoints with self-signed certificates (security warning: use with caution)
- `expand_path`: When true, expands the forward URL path to include compound paths from the original request; when false, only appends query parameters

Requires basket token authentication. The basket name is provided as a path parameter. Returns the updated Config object. Changes take effect immediately for new incoming requests.
data.reasoning: Summary is generic and doesn't convey the complexity of configuration options. Description has good technical detail but is poorly structured for AI agent parsing. Enhanced version reorganizes information for clarity, emphasizes partial update support, security implications, and immediate effect of changes. Better helps AI agents understand when and how to use this operation.
